Class QueueHospital<PatientType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hospital<PatientType>
      • QueueHospital<PatientType>
  • Type Parameters:
    PatientType - The generic type for the type of patient that the Hospital accepts.

    public class QueueHospital<PatientType>
extends Hospital<PatientType>
    Class representing a Hospital that orders its patients in the following way: Patients are ordered via a Queue. That is, the first patient admitted is the first to be treated. If more patients are added before the first patient is treated, they must wait for their turn. This is known as FIFO, or first-in-first-out ordering and is the standard model for lines at businesses (or any organized line of people).
    Version:
    2019-03-07
    Author:
    Stephen

      • nextPatient

        public PatientType nextPatient()
        Find and return the patient who will next be treated. Does not treat the patient (i.e. it is not removed from the collection of patients that the hospital still must treat).
        Specified by:
        nextPatient in class Hospital<PatientType>
        Returns:
        The patient who would be next treated.

      • treatNextPatient

        public PatientType treatNextPatient()
        Treats the next patient and removes them from the Hospital. Once someone is healed they no longer need to stay in the Hospital.
        Specified by:
        treatNextPatient in class Hospital<PatientType>
        Returns:
        The patient receiving treatment.
